page.title: 20LONGFORGAN - SPORTING LIFE -
page.content: Team sports in the village are darts and football for the male population. The football team is 2nd top of the Dundee Welfare Division IV. Matches are played at Longforgan and teams come from Dundee and district. The darts team is made up of mainly the same people, and centres around the public houses in the Carse of Gowrie. Being a rural community, clay pigeon shooting, rough shooting, wild fowling and fishing are indulged in by local residents, and there are horse riding stables in the village. The bowling club is successful with both team and individual competitors in competitions and they have a well maintained green and a modern well equipped clubhouse. There is also a cricket club at nearby Rossie Priory. There are tennis courts in the park, with a pavilion, and both are in a dilapidated condition.
